info.document:
A 79 per cent increase in football participation is expected as a result of improvements

Get daily updates directly to your inbox+ SubscribeThank you for subscribing!Could not subscribe, try again laterInvalid Email

A new multi-sports hub will be opened by Burscough Dynamo FC this weekend.

The upgraded venue will be opened on Sunday, September 10 at 11am, after undergoing extensive improvements.

The site, known as the Thomas Galvin Sports Ground, will be re-opened by Mrs Joan Galvin, as her late husband, Thomas, was instrumental in starting junior football in the Burscough area.

As part of the improvements, the club conducted a significant pitch drainage project, as the site was previously out of use due to serious waterlogging issues.

Now, the club has a state-of-the-art surface which will allow them to deliver more effective training, and reduce the number of home game cancellations.

The venue now has six full-size pitches, one 9v9 pitch, four mini-soccer pitches and a changing pavilion with clubroom.

Thanks to the upgrading of the site, Burscough Dynamo FC also has a permanent home which will help them to retain and develop their players as well as attract new ones.

An overall increase in football participation of 79 per cent is expected as a result of the improvements. This is partly thanks to the club's plans to establish 11 brand new teams.

BDFC currently has 22 teams, ranging from under-7 to adult level, which play in a number of leagues.

The club also plan to introduce a girls' under-14 and under-16 side, which will help to boost female football participation at the facility by 122 per cent across all ages.

The facility will also be used by Burscough Priory High School, Digmoor FC and Sacre Coeur FP FC's over-40 team.

It is hoped that the new hub can also support cricket sessions, and will be used by local primary schools for PE classes.

Funding for the improvements was made available via a £98,043 grant from the Premier League and The FA Facilities Fund , delivered by the Football Foundation.

Simon Kenyon, the chairman of Burscough Dynamo Football Club, said: "I would like to thank the Premier League and The FA Facilities Fund for the grant.

"The funding will allow the facility to be used once again mainly for grassroots football, but will allow us to offer cricket and other sports.

"It will also allow Burscough Dynamo FC to develop its mini-soccer, adult football and female football sections, as well as offering holiday activities and other sporting opportunities."
